## üöÄ Create your first Dot

::card-group{:cols="2"}

  ::card
  --- 
  title: "Capture your first Dot" 
  icon: "1Ô∏è‚É£üì∏"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/create-dot/select-and-say-something"

  ---
  Open the quick capture bar. Select the option of capture. Your Dot is created automatically and ready for collaboration.
  > üí° Tip: Choose the capture mode that best fits your screen or area.
  ::

  ::card
  ---
  title: "Add context with annotations"
  icon: "2Ô∏è‚É£üñäÔ∏è"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/annotations/shapes-annotation"
  ---
  Draw, highlight, or sketch directly on your Dot to explain your ideas clearly.
  > üí° Tip: Use the Highlighter for emphasis, the Pen for shapes, and the Pencil to freely draw.
  ::

  ::card
  ---
  title: "Write a quick note"
  icon: "3Ô∏è‚É£üóíÔ∏è"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/dot-kit/text-box"

  ---
  Add a Text Box with pre-written text and customize it to share instructions or feedback.
  > üí° Tip: Keep notes short and combine them with annotations for better clarity.
  ::

  ::card
  ---
  title: "Capture ideas instantly"
  icon: "4Ô∏è‚É£‚ú®"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/annotations/short-magic-marker"
  ---
  Double-click anywhere to open the Magic Marker and quickly write down your thoughts.
  > üí° Tip: Perfect for quick ideas, reminders, or spontaneous feedback.
  ::

  ::card
  ---
  title: "React visually"
  icon: "5Ô∏è‚É£üòÑüè∑Ô∏è"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/dot-kit/emojis"
  ---
 Use Emojis and Stickers to react to comments or notify your team without typing.
  > üí° Tip: Stickers are great for quick signals like approval, attention, or feedback status.
  ::

  ::card
  ---
  title: "Share and collaborate"
  icon: "6Ô∏è‚É£üîó"
  to: "/getting-started/user-guide/slide-deck/sharing"
  ---
  Share your Dot or your entire workspace with teammates or clients in one click. Everyone can view, comment, and collaborate in real time.
  > üí° Tip: Add a short message so collaborators understand the context right away.
  ::

::

## ‚û°Ô∏è Next steps

After your first capture and annotation, we recommend exploring:  

- [User Guide](/getting-started/user-guide/create-dot/create-dot) to learn about all the features of DOT APP.
